Text.Value: I... yes. Words chosen in haste, perhaps. I would rather see healing than punishment, in truth. And Oak Father willing, we shall live to witness it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Catching himself, reeling it in a little.

Text.Value: I agree.
What do you think could be done to help?
Perhaps the Shadow Druids were right, in their own twisted way. If such sorrows are the fruits of civilisation, perhaps there can be no true balance between it and nature.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: Someone is planting bombs in children's toys - what madness is taking root in this place?

EditorData.NodeContext: referring to some boobytrapped toys the player found

Text.Value: I sensed you would. A problem for another day, perhaps. I just hope there is another day.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: 'Harsh judgement'? Sounds tyrannical.
At least we took Yenna in off the streets. But there are many more out there...
Temporary crises have a habit of becoming part of the everyday, given half a chance. A rot is taking hold here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: I thought that nature would heal, and balance between it and civilisation could be restored, once and for all...

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: That poor girl, Yenna. This city will devour her as sure as any wild predator would do. Be it through malice or just neglect... her fate will be sealed by this place.

EditorData.NodeContext: Referring to an orphan girl the player encountered

Text.Value: Perhaps... but small injustices cannot be ignored forever. We will save the world, but I wish it to be a place worth saving.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: If such sorrows are the fruits of civilisation, perhaps there can be no true balance between it and nature.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: Perhaps, but sometimes a raised tone is needed to shake others from apathy.
I hope not. I truly do. But the signs say otherwise.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: For a while, after the shadow curse was lifted, I felt hope in a way that I hadn't felt in years.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: I wish I knew, truly... A problem for another day, perhaps. I just hope there is another day.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: Look around us - you will not have to search for long to see exactly what I mean.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: Perhaps you're right.
What do you mean?
Societies should be judged based on how they treat their most vulnerable. Baldur's Gate may deserve harsh judgement, from what I've seen so far.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: Yet since we neared the city, I have seen more and more signs that I was being naive. Refugees, orphans, the downtrodden... all being left behind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled by what he's seen of late. Part of a mini-arc where he dreams of a better world for all.

Text.Value: Things aren't that bad. A temporary crisis.
We can't help everyone, I'm afraid. And we'll help no one if the Absolute isn't stopped.
You're being a little dramatic, no?

Synopsis: Halsin's default in-party dialogue once you have him available as a companion. You recruit/dismiss him, and discuss an assortment of topics with him.
